p: Neobavaisoflavone (7-hydroxy-3-[4-hydroxy-3-(3-methylbut-2-enyl) phenyl] chromen-4-one) (Fig.Â 22), is a flavonoid compound isolated mainly from Psoraleacorylifolia ( Leguminosae) and Erythrina species. Psoralea corylifolia has traditionally been used in India, China and Southeastern Asian countries for the treatment of several diseases such as nephritis, asthma, cough, osteoporosis, hypertension and cardiovascular diseases [ 118, 119].
